name: src/ColumnVectorizer.mjs
ColumnVectorizer
description: class creating sparse matrices from a corpus

name: constructor
description: creates a new instance for classifying text data for machine learning
examples: const dataset = new ms.nlp.ColumnVectorizer(csvData);

unknown.tagValue: {Set} this.tokens - Unique collection of all tokenized strings
{Object[]} this.vectors - Array of tokenized words with value of count of appreance in string
{Object} this.wordMap - Object of all unique words, with value of 0
{Object} this.wordCountMap - Object of all unique words, with value as total count of appearances
{String[]} this.sortedWordCount - list of words as tokens sorted by total appearances
{String[]} this.limitedFeatures - subset list of maxFeatures words as tokens sorted by total appearances

name: get_tokens
description: Returns a distinct array of all tokens

return.description: returns a distinct array of all tokens

name: get_vector_array
description: Returns array of arrays of strings for dependent features from sparse matrix word map

return.description: returns array of dependent features for DataSet column matrics

name: fit_transform
description: Fits and transforms data by creating column vectors (a sparse matrix where each row has every word in the corpus as a column and the count of appearances in the corpus)

name: get_limited_features
description: Returns limited sets of dependent features or all dependent features sorted by word count

name: evaluateString
description: returns word map with counts
examples:
ColumnVectorizer.evaluateString('I would rate everything Great, views Great, food Great') => { realli: 0,
good: 0,
definit: 0,
recommend: 0,
wait: 0,
staff: 0,
rude: 0,
great: 3,
view: 1,
food: 1,
not: 0,
cold: 0,
took: 0,
forev: 0,
seat: 0,
time: 0,
prompt: 0,
attent: 0,
bland: 0,
flavor: 0,
kind: 0 }

return.description: object of corpus words with accounts

name: evaluate
description: returns new matrix of words with counts in columns
examples: ColumnVectorizer.evaluate('I would rate everything Great, views Great, food Great') => [ [ 0, 1, 3, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 1 ] ]

return.description: sparse matrix row for new classification predictions

name: src/DataSet.mjs
DataSet
description: class for manipulating an array of objects, typically from CSV data

name: getTransforms
description: Allows for fit transform short hand notation

return.description: returns fit columns, columns property

name: reverseColumnMatrix
description: returns an array of objects by applying labels to matrix of columns

unknown.tagValue: {Object[]} an array of objects with properties derived from options.labels

return.description: an array of objects with properties derived from options.labels

name: encodeObject
description: Returns an object into an one hot encoded object

return.description: one hot encoded object

name: oneHotEncoder
description: returns a new object of one hot encoded values

params.name: name
params.description: csv column header, or JSON object property name

name: oneHotDecoder
description: Return one hot encoded data

unknown.tagValue: {Array<Object>} returns an array of objects from an one hot encoded column

return.description: returns an array of objects from an one hot encoded column

name: selectColumns
description: returns a list of objects with only selected columns as properties

unknown.tagValue: {Object[]} an array of objects with properties derived from names

return.description: an array of objects with properties derived from names

name: columnArray
description: returns a new array of a selected column from an array of objects, can filter, scale and replace values

params.name: name
params.description: csv column header, or JSON object property name

params.name: options.replace.value
params.description: value to replace (arr[val]) if replace test is true, if a function (result,val,index,arr,name)=>your custom value

params.name: options.scale
params.description: standard or minmax feature scale values

name: columnMatrix
description: returns a matrix of values by combining column arrays into a matrix

params.name: vectors
params.description: array of arguments for columnArray to merge columns into a matrix

params.name: data
params.description: array of data to convert to matrix

return.description: a matrix of column values

name: mapToObject
description: returns a JavaScript Object from a Map (supports nested Map Objects)

unknown.tagValue: {Object} JavaScript Object converted from a Map

params.name: mapObj
params.description: Map to convert into JavaScript Object

return.description: JavaScript Object converted from a Map

name: getBinaryValue
description: returns 0 or 1 depending on the input value
examples:
DataSet.getBinaryValue('true') // => 1
DataSet.getBinaryValue('false') // => 0
DataSet.getBinaryValue('No') // => 0
DataSet.getBinaryValue(false) // => 0

unknown.tagValue: {Number} 0 or 1 depending on truthiness of value

params.name: value
params.description: value to convert to a 1 or a 0

return.description: 0 or 1 depending on truthiness of value

name: constructor
description: creates a new raw data instance for preprocessing data for machine learning
examples: const dataset = new ms.DataSet(csvData);

name: exportFeatures
description: returns Object of all encoders and scalers

unknown.tagValue: {{labels:Map,encoders:Map,scalers:map}} JavaScript Object of transforms encoders and scalers(labels, encoders, scalers)

return.description: JavaScript Object of transforms encoders and scalers(labels, encoders, scalers)

name: importFeatures
description: set encoders, labels and scalers

params.name: features
params.description: JavaScript Object of transforms encoders and scalers(labels, encoders, scalers)

name: filterColumn
description: returns filtered rows of data

return.description: filtered array of data

description: Returns a new array of scaled values which can be reverse (descaled). The scaling transformations are stored on the DataSet

params.name: name
params.description: name - csv column header, or JSON object property name

description: Returns a new array of descaled values

unknown.tagValue: {number[]} returns an array of scaled values

params.name: name
params.description: name - csv column header, or JSON object property name

return.description: returns an array of scaled values

name: labelEncoder
description: returns a new array and label encodes a selected column

params.name: name
params.description: csv column header, or JSON object property name

params.name: options.binary
params.description: only replace with (0,1) with binary values

params.name: options.sortFunction
params.description: custom label encoding value sort function

name: labelDecode
description: returns a new array and decodes an encoded column back to the original array values

params.name: name
params.description: csv column header, or JSON object property name

name: oneHotColumnArray
description: Return one hot encoded data

unknown.tagValue: {Array<Object>} returns an array of objects from an one hot encoded column

return.description: returns an array of objects from an one hot encoded column

name: columnReducer
description: it returns a new column that reduces a column into a new column object, this is used in data prep to create new calculated columns for aggregrate statistics

unknown.tagValue: {Object} a new object that has reduced array as the value

params.name: options.reducer
params.description: reducer function to reduce into new array, it should push values into the resulting array

return.description: a new object that has reduced array as the value

name: columnMerge
description: it returns a new column that is merged onto the data set

name: inverseTransformObject
description: Inverses transform on an object

unknown.tagValue: {Object} returns object with inverse transformed data

return.description: returns object with inverse transformed data

name: transformObject
description: transforms an object and replaces values that have been scaled or encoded

name: columnReplace
description: returns a new array of a selected column from an array of objects and replaces empty values, encodes values and scales values

params.name: name
params.description: csv column header, or JSON object property name

params.name: options.strategy
params.description: strategy for replacing value, any array stat method from ml.js (mean, standardDeviation, median) or (label,labelEncoder,onehot,oneHotEncoder)

name: fitColumns
description: mutates data property of DataSet by replacing multiple columns in a single command

name: fitInverseTransforms
description: Mutate dataset data by inversing all transforms

name: fitTransforms
description: Mutate dataset data with all transforms

name: src/ReinforcedLearning.mjs
ReinforcedLearningBase
description: base interface class for reinforced learning

name: constructor
description: base class for reinforced learning

name: learn
description: interface instance method for reinforced learning step

name: train
description: interface instance method for reinforced training step

name: predict
description: interface instance method for reinforced prediction step

name: UpperConfidenceBound
description: Implementation of the Upper Confidence Bound algorithm

name: constructor
description: creates a new instance of the Upper confidence bound(UCB) algorithm. UCB is based on the principle of optimism in the face of uncertainty, which is to choose your actions as if the environment (in this case bandit) is as nice as is plausibly possible
examples: const dataset = new ms.ml.UpperConfidenceBound({bounds:10});

unknown.tagValue: {Map} this.numbers_of_selections - map of all bound selections

name: predict
description: returns next action based off of the upper confidence bound

return.description: returns bound selection

name: learn
description: single step trainning method

params.name: getBound
params.description: select value of ucbRow by selection value

name: train
description: training method for upper confidence bound calculations

params.name: getBound
params.description: select value of ucbRow by selection value

name: ThompsonSampling
description: Implementation of the Thompson Sampling algorithm

name: constructor
description: creates a new instance of the Thompson Sampling(TS) algorithm. TS a heuristic for choosing actions that addresses the exploration-exploitation dilemma in the multi-armed bandit problem. It consists in choosing the action that maximizes the expected reward with respect to a randomly drawn belief
examples: const dataset = new ms.ml.ThompsonSampling({bounds:10});

unknown.tagValue: {Map} this.numbers_of_rewards_1 - map of all reward 1 selections
{Map} this.numbers_of_rewards_0 - map of all reward 0 selections

name: predict
description: returns next action based off of the thompson sampling

return.description: returns thompson sample

name: learn
description: single step trainning method

params.name: getBound
params.description: select value of tsRow by selection value

name: train
description: training method for thompson sampling calculations

params.name: getBound
params.description: select value of tsRow by selection value

getTransactions
description: Formats an array of transactions into a sparse matrix like format for Apriori/Eclat

unknown.tagValue: {Object} {values - unique list of all values, valuesMap - map of values and labels, transactions - formatted sparse array}

return.description: {values - unique list of all values, valuesMap - map of values and labels, transactions - formatted sparse array}

name: assocationRuleLearning
description: returns association rule learning results

unknown.tagValue: {Object} Returns the result from Node-FPGrowth or a summary of support and strong associations

params.name: options.valuesMap
params.description: map of values and labels (used for summary results)

return.description: Returns the result from Node-FPGrowth or a summary of support and strong associations

name: src/cross_validation.mjs
train_test_split
description: Split arrays into random train and test subsets

unknown.tagValue: {(Object|array)} returns training and test arrays either as an object or arrays

params.name: options.test_size
params.description: represent the proportion of the dataset to include in the test split, can be overwritten by the train_size

params.name: options.train_size
params.description: represent the proportion of the dataset to include in the train split

params.name: options.random_state
params.description: the seed used by the random number generator

params.name: options.return_array
params.description: will return an object {train,test} of the split dataset by default or [train,test] if returned as an array

return.description: returns training and test arrays either as an object or arrays

name: cross_validation_split
description:
Provides train/test indices to split data in train/test sets. Split dataset into k consecutive folds.
Each fold is then used once as a validation while the k - 1 remaining folds form the training set.

unknown.tagValue: {array} returns  dataset split into k consecutive folds

params.name: options.random_state
params.description: the seed used by the random number generator

return.description: returns  dataset split into k consecutive folds

name: cross_validate_score
description: Used to test variance and bias of a prediction

params.name: options.classifier
params.description: instance of classification model used for training, or function to train a model. e.g. new DecisionTreeClassifier({ gainFunction: 'gini', }) or ml.KNN

params.name: options.regression
params.description: instance of regression model used for training, or function to train a model. e.g. new RandomForestRegression({ nEstimators: 300, }) or ml.MultivariateLinearRegression

return.description: Array of accucracy calculations

name: grid_search
description: Used to test variance and bias of a prediction with parameter tuning

params.name: options.classifier
params.description: instance of classification model used for training, or function to train a model. e.g. new DecisionTreeClassifier({ gainFunction: 'gini', }) or ml.KNN

params.name: options.regression
params.description: instance of regression model used for training, or function to train a model. e.g. new RandomForestRegression({ nEstimators: 300, }) or ml.MultivariateLinearRegression

return.description: Array of accucracy calculations

name: src/csv.mjs
loadCSVURI
description: Asynchronously loads a CSV from a remote URL and returns an array of objects
examples:
// returns [{header:value,header2:value2}]
loadCSVURI('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/repetere/modelscript/master/test/mock/data.csv').then(csvData).catch(console.error)

unknown.tagValue: {Object[]} returns an array of objects from a csv where each column header is the property name

return.description: returns an array of objects from a csv where each column header is the property name

name: loadCSV
description: Asynchronously loads a CSV from either a filepath or remote URL and returns an array of objects
examples:
// returns [{header:value,header2:value2}]
loadCSV('../mock/invalid-file.csv').then(csvData).catch(console.error)

unknown.tagValue: {Object[]} returns an array of objects from a csv where each column header is the property name

return.description: returns an array of objects from a csv where each column header is the property name

name: loadTSV
description: Asynchronously loads a TSV from either a filepath or remote URL and returns an array of objects
examples:
// returns [{header:value,header2:value2}]
loadCSV('../mock/invalid-file.tsv').then(csvData).catch(console.error)

unknown.tagValue: {Object[]} returns an array of objects from a csv where each column header is the property name

return.description: returns an array of objects from a csv where each column header is the property name

src/ml.mjs
src/nlp.mjs
src/pd.mjs
src/util.mjs
squaredDifference
description: Returns an array of the squared different of two arrays

unknown.tagValue: {Number[]} Squared difference of left minus right array

return.description: Squared difference of left minus right array

name: standardError
description: The standard error of the estimate is a measure of the accuracy of predictions made with a regression line. Compares the estimate to the actual value

return.description: Standard Error of the Estimate

name: standardScore
description: Calculates the z score of each value in the sample, relative to the sample mean and standard deviation.

unknown.tagValue: {Number[]} The z-scores, standardized by mean and standard deviation of input array

params.name: observations
params.description: An array like object containing the sample data.

return.description: The z-scores, standardized by mean and standard deviation of input array

name: coefficientOfDetermination
description:
In statistics, the coefficient of determination, denoted R2 or r2 and pronounced "R squared", is the proportion of the variance in the dependent variable that is predictable from the independent variable(s). Compares distance of estimated values to the mean.
{\bar {y}}={\frac {1}{n}}\sum _{i=1}^{n}y_{i}

name: adjustedCoefficentOfDetermination
description: You can use the adjusted coefficient of determination to determine how well a multiple regression equation fits the sample data. The adjusted coefficient of determination is closely related to the coefficient of determination (also known as R2) that you use to test the results of a simple regression equation.

unknown.tagValue: {Number} adjusted r^2 for multiple linear regression

params.name: options.independentVariables
params.description: the number of independent variables in the regression equation

return.description: adjusted r^2 for multiple linear regression

name: coefficientOfCorrelation
description: The coefficent of Correlation is given by R decides how well the given data fits a line or a curve.

return.description: R

name: rSquared
description: The coefficent of determination is given by r^2 decides how well the given data fits a line or a curve.

name: pivotVector
description: returns an array of vectors as an array of arrays

name: pivotArrays
description: returns a matrix of values by combining arrays into a matrix

params.name: vectors
params.description: array of arguments for columnArray to merge columns into a matrix

return.description: a matrix of column values

name: StandardScaler
description:
Standardize features by removing the mean and scaling to unit variance

Centering and scaling happen independently on each feature by computing the relevant statistics on the samples in the training set. Mean and standard deviation are then stored to be used on later data using the transform method.

Standardization of a dataset is a common requirement for many machine learning estimators: they might behave badly if the individual feature do not more or less look like standard normally distributed data (e.g. Gaussian with 0 mean and unit variance)

name: StandardScalerTransforms
description: This function returns two functions that can standard scale new inputs and reverse scale new outputs

return.description: {scale[ Function ], descale[ Function ]}

name: MinMaxScaler
description:
Transforms features by scaling each feature to a given range.
This estimator scales and translates each feature individually such that it is in the given range on the training set, i.e. between zero and one.

name: MinMaxScalerTransforms
description: This function returns two functions that can mix max scale new inputs and reverse scale new outputs

return.description: {scale[ Function ], descale[ Function ]}

name: approximateZPercentile
description: Converts z-score into the probability

params.name: z
params.description: Number of standard deviations from the mean.

return.description: p  - p-value

name: getSafePropertyName
description: returns a safe column name / url slug from a string

name: forecastErrors
description: The errors (residuals) from acutals and estimates

return.description: errors (residuals)

name: meanForecastError
description: The bias of forecast accuracy

return.description: MFE (bias)

name: meanAbsoluteDeviation
description: Mean Absolute Deviation (MAD) indicates the absolute size of the errors

return.description: MAD

name: trackingSignal
description: Tracking Signal - Used to pinpoint forecasting models that need adjustment

return.description: trackingSignal

name: meanSquaredError
description: The standard error of the estimate is a measure of the accuracy of predictions made with a regression line. Compares the estimate to the actual value

return.description: MSE

name: MADMeanRatio
description: MAD over Mean Ratio - The MAD/Mean ratio is an alternative to the MAPE that is better suited to intermittent and low-volume data. As stated previously, percentage errors cannot be calculated when the actual equals zero and can take on extreme values when dealing with low-volume data. These issues become magnified when you start to average MAPEs over multiple time series. The MAD/Mean ratio tries to overcome this problem by dividing the MAD by the Meanessentially rescaling the error to make it comparable across time series of varying scales

return.description: MMR

name: meanAbsolutePercentageError
description: MAPE (Mean Absolute Percent Error) measures the size of the error in percentage terms

return.description: MAPE
